page.title: 18A ST.AGNES SMALLHOLDING
page.content: POLGARTH FARM IS A FARM HOUSE WHICH HAS BEEN STANDING SINCE THE 17TH CENTURY IT HAS BEEN USED FOR MANY THINGS.IT WAS A COACHING INN AND EARLY THIS CENTURY WAS A SMALL SCHOOL.THE PRESENT OCCUPANTS, THE PARRIS'S HAVE DISCOVERED SOME OF THE OLD DESKS COMPLETE WITH THEIR INK WELLS. POLGARTH IS NOW ONLY A SMALLHOLDING WITH A FEW FIELDS SURROUNDING THE HOUSE.THEY HAVE A VARIETY OF LIVESTOCK INCLUDING EIGHT DUCKS,ONE GOOSE,ONE PONY WHICH IS DARK BROWN IN COLOUR, BUT IS ACTUALLY CALLED BLACKIE AND TWENTY SIX BULLOCKS.THE BULLOCKS ARE BLACK AND WHITE AND ARE HEREFORD CROSS FRIESIAN.THERE IS A SILAGE STORE IN A CORNER OF THE FARMYARD, A DUCK_POND AND A LIMITED AMOUNT OF FARM MACHINERY.
